intro: Papuacalia mogrere, commonly known as the New Zealand mountain daisy, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. It has a low-growing habit with woody stems and is often found in rocky or scree environments. Papuacalia mogrere is an important species for pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of New Zealand's native flora.
